author: ressi
post_text: June 27, 2014 at 5:35 PM#1Hi everyone,since version 3.0  i have a problem with a macro i'm using.The macro stores several color sequences with the following syntax:Group $ColSeqFixture At Preset "Cyan"When executing the command line says "Error #14: Object does not exist". But indeed the color preset does exists.I did not find anything in the release notes.Anyone has an idea?Actually i don't want to use preset numbers for this macro because i don't always use the same numbers for my colors.Thanks a lotressi

posts.author: ressi
posts.post_text: June 27, 2014 at 5:35 PM#1Hi everyone,since version 3.0  i have a problem with a macro i'm using.The macro stores several color sequences with the following syntax:Group $ColSeqFixture At Preset "Cyan"When executing the command line says "Error #14: Object does not exist". But indeed the color preset does exists.I did not find anything in the release notes.Anyone has an idea?Actually i don't want to use preset numbers for this macro because i don't always use the same numbers for my colors.Thanks a lotressi

posts.author: ressi
posts.post_text: June 27, 2014 at 6:36 PM#2Hi again,i don't know why but i tried again and it works.The only thing that has changed is that i added two extra lines to turn BlindEdit on and off.As far as i look at my cmd history i tried to assign a preset by using a name. After i saw that it is working i tried out the macro again and it worked.

posts.author: RomanP
posts.post_text: June 28, 2014 at 7:53 AM#3Hi,we had also problems with some macros that uses Presets by Name.i think you must use a *try thisGroup $ColSeqFixture At Preset *."Cyan"for us it worked soSorry for my bad english

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: July 1, 2014 at 12:29 AM#4Roman is right, with version 3:CodePreset "Cyan"will search the pool of the current/selected presettype for a preset labeled "Cyan"CodePreset *."Cyan"will search all preset pools for a preset labeled "Cyan"CodePreset 4."Cyan"orCodePreset "Color"."Cyan"will search the color preset pool for a preset labeled "Cyan"

title: Store Preset Macro with Name
